III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & R 400.12404 – Placement
Section (4) An agency shall consider all of the following factors in selecting
Description an appropriate placement for a child.
(b) The physical, emotional, and educational needs of the
child.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency failed to assess a home prior to foster care
placement.
1

Investigation Interviews:
Attempts were made to interview Complainant on 03/11/2025
and 03/19/2025 but were unsuccessful. I interviewed
Complainant by phone on 03/24/2025. Complainant reported
receiving payment for the time the children were placed in
Complainant’s care.
I interviewed Placement Worker and Foster Care Supervisor by
telephone on 01/23/2025. Foster Care Supervisor and Placement
Worker both reported Youth A and Youth B were initially placed in
the home on 12/17/2024 by Child Protective Services. Foster
Care Supervisor stated the caregiver reported receiving an
eviction notice prior to the placement of Youth A and Youth B.
Foster Care Supervisor stated a change in placement was in
process and notice had been given to the caretaker 01/14/2025.
Placement Worker stated they completed a Relative Approval
and Placement Safety Screen - MDHHS - 5770 on 12/17/2024.
Placement Worker stated the home only had one bedroom and
did not have enough beds for Youth A, Youth B, and all the other
occupants of the home. Placement Worker stated the agency’s
Initial Home Assessment (3130-A) with a completed dated
01/22/2025 recommended denial. Placement Worker stated the
court ordered placement approval anyway. Placement Worker
stated a subsequent assessment was then completed with an
approval recommendation so the caregiver could receive
funding/payment for the placement of Youth A and Youth B.
Documents Reviewed:
The placement records for Youth A and Youth B were reviewed.
This record indicated the youth were initially placed on 12/17/2024
and were subsequently replaced in a licensed home effective
01/31/2025.
The initial MDHHS-5770 completed dated 12/17/2024, noted initial
emergency placement safety screen type. This indicated
adequate number of sleeping spaces but noted to provide air
mattresses and bedding. This also indicated caregiver had
adequate household resources but noted working but may need
assistance i.e. Food and Foster Care payments. The 5770 did not
recommend placement but noted the court ordered placement
against recommendation.
Initial 3130-A dated 01/22/2025 with a denial recommendation due
to the concerns with space.
2

The subsequent addendum dated 01/23/2025 with an approval
recommendation to reflect the court order approval was reviewed.
It noted caregiver was struggling financially and is behind on rent.
The report noted the court ordered placement with caregiver
against MDHHS recommendation. MDHHS did not recommend
placement because the home is too small for three children and
one adult with there being only one bedroom.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with the rule as the agency
appropriately assessed the home and recommended denial of
placement based on lack of space and finances however the court
continued to order a direct placement against the agency’s
recommendation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
